content: this legal text summarizes a court case that took place in ghent on november 10th 2016 it discusses the division of matrimonial property related to a petrol station and its assets the ability to manage the petrol station is considered joint property while the income generated from it is the responsibility of the spouse managing it however the stock of goods related to the station is considered joint property disputes regarding the accounting of the stations operation and the valuation of stocks are addressed and it is determined that these should be included in the liquidationdistribution statement the absence of a consignment system for fuels and lack of evidence regarding stock ownership make it difficult to clarify the division of assets objections regarding these matters are dismissed solidifying the legal stance on property division and accountability the decision was made by the court of appeal in ghent with specific individuals serving as the chairman counsellors and lawyer the case pertains to matrimonial property law and the operation of a petrol station in the context of a divorce settlement the text concludes that the valuation of stock goods and the accounting of the petrol stations operation should be included in the liquidation distribution objections raised regarding stock ownership and the existence of a consignment system are rejected
